Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2013 03:37AM fenella wrote: Aww Julienne thank you so much. I'm in the UK too and it's nice to know others are in the same boat.  I have to be fair to the consultant and radiologist they have taken me seriously and been great...they just haven't escalated it when they haven't found a conclusive answer. If i go private to any of the really local private hospitals it is the same breast consultant who is actually very good indeed to be fair...she sent me for another u/s after a 6 week wait and see and said it might be worth doing another mamo ....the radiologist decided that cos it was only 11 months since my last mammo to not bother...I've been reasonably calm till now...when they were checking checking and double checking but since being sent away saying we're not sure but we think your ok i've started to panic again...i'm checking my boobs morning and night....there is an area in the same area as teh problem cyst but maybe slightly deeper...and then this long lump that feels like a stringy ligament...All they can see are simply cysts on the ultrasound which has been done my 2 radiologists now. arrrgh. I've had a friend btw who was told Fatty Lump honestly god knows. In a way i'd just like them to find the area so a biopsy can be done. I've now made another appointment with my GP to talk through my concerns with her...she's very good. I just feel bad if i go back to the breast clinic just 2 weeks after the last time..for possibly the same reason and yet another new lump. It's madness. Let me know how you get on with everything. What happened with the FNA was it solid or fluid?

Posts.Content: fenella wrote: Feel like screaming...i've been struggling with fibrocystic breasts for a year now....no pain just lots of cysts....one turned out to be filled with blood when aspirated....then they found abnormal cells....but then couldn't find the area to biopsy because of all the cysts. so i was discharged and told to come back if i feel any change.  Birads 3....i'm terrified i know the risk is v.low but they still cannot be sure i do not have cancer.  I had a mammo 1 year ago...and about 5 ultrasounds in teh last year. I still feel an area where the problem cyst was but not sure it's the same one...and now I have found another weird lump that feels very different to all my "cysts" it's long and stringy like a vein or thin ligament it runs from the side of my areaola right across the breast (centre to about 9 o clock) now i dont' know if i go back to the breast clinic....see my gp for another referral to the breast clinic or book a private MRI as that is the only test i haven't had and haven't been sent for. Starting to feel like they will not take me seriously with all these lumps and bumps but i dont' want to leave it as the one i don't get checked will teh be the bad one...it's only a week since my last ultrasound and was told i look normal. Sorry for the rant but it's all really starting to get to me now.  I don't know what is what. Thanks for any advice. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: End of my tether don't know which way to turn fenella fenella

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2013 07:59AM fenella wrote: Hi there. I'm 36 too. Try not to panic you've done the right thing by scheduling the appointment. I know it's really scary and for some reason we just think the complete worst. Age is on your side and most lumps are benign. Try not to google too much it will send you crazy and the information isn't always relevent....one study i read was on women back in the 70's so totally out of date. Let us know how you get on, stay calm there are many benign things it could turn out to be. fingers crossed for you :)
Posts.Title: Breast lump for 3-4 mos, now hard pea-size bump on left clavicle baml connie432

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2013 07:06AM fenella wrote: Hey there. Try to stay calm it's unbelievably unlikely you have anything to worry about here. Normally I wouldn't recommend googling but I think the stats on breast cancer for your age might calm you down...hey i'm 36 and only 1500 women a year in the UK are diagnosed each year between the ages of 35-39. So you can image how slim the odds are for young women like you.  I'm also a mum and I know if you were my daughter I would probably feel more hurt that you didn't come to me than i would feel anxious because of the lump. Please do tell your mum to take you to see your doctor, you might have an infected spot or something, there are probably hundreds of benign causes for your lump. Ok don't google i've just done that, between 2008 and 2010 in the UK there were no women diagnosed with cancer between the ages of 15 and 19. I know your in the states but even so you get the picture.  Take care.

This lump didn't disappear when i returned it was starting to shrink but was filled with blood but it was sent for a report. The report came back as negative for cancerous cells but not totally normal. I asked what wasn't normal she said it was a little "Chunky" for what they expect with a simple cyst. Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2013 08:51AM fenella wrote: Yes the cysts that I have felt have been aspirated by ultrasound. They have all looked to be simple on ultrasound too. The results from the tests came back with no cancerous cells but nor did it look totally normal. Apparently it was more chunky than they would expect from a simple cyst. I don't know what they mean by chunky, possibly the thickness of the fluid i presume and I'm not sure why chunky fluid is a concern. Good to know about so many women who also had cysts, especially complex ones that were benign.

Posts.Title: Can Cancer Cause Cysts fenella fenella

Posts.Content: fenella wrote: Hi all thought I would start this thread as I've been on and off these boards for the last year with various lumps and bumps due to fibrocystic breasts. I feel for the last year their has been a constant anxiety in the back of my mind every time i find something new. Looking through many threads I see lots of women with fibrocystic issues and thought this woud be a good place to help and support Women who are living with the fear that fibrocystic breasts causes and to talk about our experiences with our fibrocystic boobs. My history I'm 36 from the UK March 2012 - Simple cyst aspirated seen on Mammo, confirmed by u/s - aspirated. Many other cysts found on u/s too. Nov 2012 - Simple Cyst Aspirated Dec 2012 - Cyst refilled with Blood. Sent for cytology Jan 2013 - No cancer found but abnormal cells discovered biopsy requested. Area to biopsy could not be found due to aspiration and many other cysts. Feb 2013 - Follow up appointment site still cannot be located on ultrasound. Told probably normal lots of simple cysts seen. 26/2/2013 - Long stringy lump found - is there no end to this? I feel my boobs pretty much morning and night and no longer know what i cannot feel...though when something is new i'm pretty good at finding it. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Indent or no indent, that is the question. EmD EmD

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2013 02:13PM fenella wrote: Oh the referral will be good make you feel like you are more in control. After my first cyst I popped a bottle of champagne...now hoping i didn't celebrate too soon. my vein sounds a little different it is a straight line horizonal about 1-2cms above the areola it then tilts down the side and stops for a bit where the fibrous full and cysty bits are at 9 o clock then picks back up underneath and goes down the breast, possibly called the milk line i'm not sure. Never noticed this vein till my first cyst, though admittedly i never overly examined my breasts before that other than a wash in the shower, then i googled veins and breast cancer, bad move, though admittedly there wasn't much on it, I mentioned my to the breast dr last time i went and she just said it could be more obvious because of the cysts and that she didn't get very excited about veins. recently on my left breast ive noticed another obvious vein down the areaola which is quite comforting...hopefully. Honestly i over analyse every little thing now, hopefully as time goes on once i have identified every little quirk my breast has I will be well aware of new changes.

Posts.Title: Benign results sign out thread. :) :) :) little_me PurpleCat

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2013 05:57AM fenella wrote: Hey there. I can't offer you much advice regarding microcalcifications as my lumps are cyst based. However I can totally relate to your fear and anxiety. I'm 36 and have 2 sons 9 and 6. When I found my first lump I was in bits, it was the darkest place i'd ever been, I didn't tell my sons what was happening and it was really hard to hold it together around them, it turned out to be a benign cyst. Since then I've had another simple cyst and a suspicious one (bloody aspirate) thye want to do a biopsy but as they aspirated it, it seems to have disappeared which is good but I have many other cysts so they can't be sure if it is one of those. If i feel I have to make another appointment, failing that I have to go back in 6 weeks. I'm pretty much in a constant state of anxiety but I was determined this time not to go back to the dark place of before. The only way i have managed to do that is not to allow myself to think to far down the line, if you feel your mind wondering try to think of something else. I know you won't forget about it entirely, it's constantly in my mind but the awful darkest thoughts I try to keep under control.   Good luck with your biopsy and let us know how things turn out.
